name: Iced Caramel Latte Pops
author: SandyG
summary: A layered ice pop with cold-brew coffee, caramel, and milk make for a refreshing treat.
ingredients: ½ cup cold brew coffee concentrate (1:1 ratio for mixing with water)
6 tablespoons caramel sauce or caramel ice cream topping
2 tablespoons chocolate-covered espresso beans, coarsely chopped
directions: Milk Layer: Whisk together milk, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla in a large measuring cup with a spout until well combined
Pour into 6 (3-ounce) ice pop molds, dividing evenly
Freeze until firm but not frozen, about 2 hours
Set a timer and check early
If they freeze all the way, your stick won't go in and your layers may separate
Coffee Layer: Whisk together coffee concentrate, milk, and sweetened condensed milk in a large measuring cup with a spout until well combined
Pour into molds over milk layer, dividing evenly
Freeze until firm but not frozen, about 2 hours
Caramel Layer: Spoon 1 tablespoon caramel sauce over coffee layer in each mold
Sprinkle each with 1 teaspoon espresso beans
Freeze until solid, at least 8 hours and up to 2 weeks
